alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 7:08PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Hill and Liberty. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 704 PM MDT, Montana Department of Transportation reported snowmelt flooding leading to water over roadways. Flooding is already occurring. - Obey law enforcement requests in the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester, Joplin, Inverness, Lothair, Rudyard, Tiber Dam and Whitlash. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
